content: Former constituency in SingaporeThis article **relies largely or entirely on a single source**. Relevant discussion may be found on the talk page. Please help improve this article by introducing citations to additional sources. *Find sources:* "Katong Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(September 2020)* **Katong** **Constituency** was a constituency in Singapore from 1951 until 1959 and from 1968 until 1984. In 1951, the constituency was carved out from [Municipal North–East Constituency](/wiki/Municipal_North%E2%80%93East_Constituency) and was represented in the [Legislative Council](/wiki/Legislative_Council_of_Singapore) from 1951 until 1955. In 1955, parts of the constituency was carved out to form [Geylang](/wiki/Geylang_Constituency) and [Paya Lebar](/wiki/Paya_Lebar_Constituency) constituencies but it remained represented in the [Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore) from 1955 until 1959 where it was abolished. The constituency was split into [Joo Chiat](/wiki/Joo_Chiat_Constituency), [Mountbatten](/wiki/Mountbatten_Constituency) and [Siglap](/wiki/Siglap_Constituency) constituencies. In 1968, the constituency was reformed by carving out from [Mountbatten Constituency](/wiki/Mountbatten_Constituency) and lasted till 1984 where it was once again abolished and split into Joo Chiat and Mountbatten constituencies. ## Member of Parliament YearMember of ParliamentParty[Legislative Council of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Council_of_Singapore)[**1951**](/wiki/1951_Singaporean_general_election)[John Laycock](/wiki/John_Laycock)[PP](/wiki/Progressive_Party_(Singapore))[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)[**1955**](/wiki/1955_Singaporean_general_election)[Armand Joseph Braga](/wiki/Armand_Joseph_Braga)[LF](/wiki/Labour_Front)*Constituency abolished (1959– 1968)*[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)[**1968**](/wiki/1968_Singaporean_general_election)Joseph Francis De Conceicao[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[**1972**](/wiki/1972_Singaporean_general_election)[**1976**](/wiki/1976_Singaporean_general_election)[**1980**](/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election) ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election
